qas.question: When did the term Nasara become used more in modern times?
What was spray pained on the properties of Christians who left the area?
Which term means followers of the Islamic State of Iraq?
In which month of 105 did the term Nasara rise to prominence?
Which term rose to prominence after the nun was spraypainted on Christian property?
Which words are commonly used for Christians in the Sryiac?
When did the term Nasara fall in prominence?

context: In Arabic-speaking cultures, two words are commonly used for Christians: <b7_0>Naṣrānī (نصراني), plural Naṣārā<b7_0/> (نصارى) is generally understood to be derived from Nazareth through the Syriac (Aramaic); <b4_0>Masīḥī<b4_0/> (مسيحي) means <a0_0>followers of the Messiah<a0_0/>. The term <b6_0>Nasara<b6_0/> rose to prominence in <a1_0><b5_0><b8_0>July<b5_0/> 2014<b8_0/><a1_0/>, after <a2_0>the Fall of Mosul<a2_0/> to the terrorist organization Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant. The nun or ن— <a3_0>the first letter of Nasara<a3_0/>—was spray-painted on the property of Christians ejected from the city.
